alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 9:28PM PST until December 31 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST SUNDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding. For the High Surf Advisory, breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet through tonight, subsiding to 6 to 10 feet Sunday and persisting into Sunday evening. Strong rip currents. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 9 PM PST Sunday. For the High Surf Advisory, until 8 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of sea water is possible around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides of 5.4 feet are expected at around 1100 AM Sunday.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
